description: Borrowed from the participle stem of Latin ingeminō (“repeat, reiterate”).

adjectives.description: ingeminate (comparative more ingeminate, superlative most ingeminate)

examples: It is an ingeminate expression of our labours . And that supposes us to have faculties capable of improvement

verbs.description: ingeminate (third-person singular simple present ingeminates, present participle ingeminating, simple past and past participle ingeminated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To say (a statement, word etc.) two or more times; to reiterate, to emphasize through repetition.
examples: we found a black pavillion; in it three old Arabians; who, out of their Alcoran ingeminated a dolefull requiem to their Brothers carcasse, over which they sat  […]
